intro: Thyrsodium puberulum, commonly known as the silky thyrsodium, is a flowering plant native to southern South America. It is characterized by its small, clustered flowers and hairy, glandular leaves that give it a distinctive appearance. The plant typically grows in open, sunny habitats such as grasslands and rocky slopes. Its flowers are usually white or pale yellow, and it produces small, dry fruits. Thyrsodium puberulum is often found in disturbed soils and is adapted to arid or semi-arid conditions.
